forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 46. North northeast wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Sunny then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Northwest wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a quiet stillness hangs in the air, wrapped in a mostly cloudy embrace that hints of the chill of night lingering just past the horizon. As temperatures hover around a mild 46 degrees, a gentle north-northeast breeze whispers through the streets, soothing yet crisp, encouraging a cocooning layer of warmth. This morning, however, reveals a city caught in a delicate balance; while remnants of fog play along the edges of the skyline, the promise of a sunlit afternoon gently stirs under the cloaks of cloud cover.

As the day unfolds, a shift is expected. By late afternoon, clouds will yield a slim chance of rain, punctuated by brief bursts of sunshine as the day’s high inching towards 59. The atmosphere carries an electric anticipation, hinting at possibility as afternoon shadows dance around fallen leaves. With the anticipated moisture spooking the clouds into a flicker of activity, a light jacket or layer atop a favorite sweater will cradle the warmth against the chill, while sturdy footwear remains token against any puddle left behind. This would be an ideal time for a leisurely stroll through the nearby streets, enjoying the buzz of cafes spilling aromas into the crisp air, or perhaps dipping into a small bookstore, inviting the narrative of the city to envelop one for an hour or two.
